body: @mistercrunch well that's fun wrinkle in their syntax.

My issue happens on Internet Explorer 11. Similar to olbapito, my javascript code in the Html markup chart also stopped working. And for Html markup chart that does not have javascript, I.E doesn't output any display. The html is along the similar lines of: ` document.getElementById("img_01").src="/images/.XXX.jpg?"+timestamp; ...
`

That's a security feature, we now sandbox your html/markdown into an iframe to prevent CRSF attacks. We do allow scripting though. More about it here:
https://www.w3schools.com/tags/att_iframe_sandbox.asp
Please re-open. Sorry I closed PRs that had merge conflicts a little while back...

Issue is still present in 0.19.1.

Actually, a functioning vertical scrollbar is there, however, it is only visible when scrolling to the far right of the horizontal scroll range.

![sqllab_scroll2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1220356/29868783-a1d4478c-8d80-11e7-97b9-9f0e0893a43b.PNG)

So, as soon as there is a horizontal scrollbar present, we happen to have _two_ vertical scrollbars, of which the outer one ist the one which is always visible, but the inner one ist the one that actually works.
Welcome on board!
Thanks for the info, appreciate it

LGTM
@mistercrunch LGTM Thank you! I wonder if there is a nice way to set `min periods` to `periods` by default? Or is it also common to *not* want that?

It seems like a better default, though it could change existing assets which is not ideal. For sum it's a much better default, for average it's many may want to see it converge... Leaving as is for now.
Kk makes sense!

How come you are getting infinity as an option.

![parse error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4454540/29906700-1c360024-8e30-11e7-940f-1b404e101385.png)
The whole dashboard. I want to avoid people seeing outdated data because they didn´t remember to set the auto refresh every time the access the dashboard.

Would it be considered as a useful feature for Superset, or is it still an open question?
For us it is the only difference with the main repository. I would definitely like to work on a PR.

@xrmx any solutions on this?  If not, can you tell me how to run this in python 2.7.

@bmackattack if you are using the wrong key the only solution is to use the right one, you are the only one who knows it. My patch just makes the error explicit.
You're not on the latest `master`, or you haven't re-built the javascript, or you haven't forced-refresh the assets in your browser
Thanks, @mistercrunch

Current solution works for sync queries but doesn't for async. It says 

> '_AppCtxGlobals' object has no attribute 'user'

Which makes sense. My first idea would be to pass it as a parameter to `get_sql_results` for the async case.
FYI You typed two different hosts

Yes, I see that. I tried with both and received the same error.
The Elasticache is actually a cluster with 3 instances. 1 Primary and 2 replicas for redundancy.
The endpoint host without the -001, I believe automatically redirects to the primary (001 when there are no issues), so there should be no difference. (You can see in the error traceback, that it is still pointing to -001, even though I don't specify that in the celery broker URL).

In any case, the flask-cache works with both hosts, and the celery returns the same error both.

EDIT:
I also just tried running redis-server locally and using the localhost as the broker, and actually received the same error.

I have a vague remember we have some sorts of helpers that returns the available datasources or permissions. [after a bit...] Maybe there's something you can reuse something from BaseSupersetView.accessible_by_user?

@xrmx thanks for the feedback. I already checked `BaseSupersetView.accessible_by_user`, but it returns names (strings) rather than the datasource objects we need here. Plus, it queries individual databases rather than the tables and datasources tables of superset database. What do you think?

I'm using v0.19.1, and change DRUID_TZ to tz.gettz('Asia/Shanghai'), Druid intervals is changed, add +08:00, but granularity timeZone is set to 'CST', which is not correct for Druid, timeZone should be set to 'Asia/Shanghai'.  
The code is here [models.py](https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/blob/master/superset/connectors/druid/models.py#L829), `timezone = from_dttm.tzname()`, return 'CST' when set DRUID_TZ=tz.gettz('Asia/Shanghai').
Authentication is handled by flask app builder, have you checked it doesn't already have hooks?
